reason.tex: \textbf{The Product Rule}\text{ says that if }\\ m(x) = n(x)\cdot p(x)\text{ then }m'(x) = n'p + np'.

options.tex: \begin{align} \log f(x) &= \cos x\cdot \log(\log x) \\ \implies \dfrac{1}{f(x)}f'(x) &= \log(\log x)\frac{d}{dx}\cos x \\ &+ \cos x\cdot\frac{d}{dx}\log(\log x)) \\ &= -\sin x\cdot\log(\log x) \\ &+ \cos x\cdot \left[\frac{1}{\log x}\cdot\frac{d}{dx}\log x\right] \\ &= \left[\frac{\cos x}{x\cdot\log x} - \sin x\cdot\log(\log x)\right] \\ \therefore f'(x) = (\log x)^{\cos x}\cdot&\left[\frac{\cos x}{x\cdot\log x} - \sin x\cdot\log(\log x)\right] \end{align}
